image.altText: A man raises his hand in front of a crowd of protesters

props.synopsis: The camera operator was filming protesters push a garbage bin towards police officers when they began firing on the crowd, ultimately hitting him. Follow live.

title.children: ABC camera operator hit with less lethal round whilst filming LA protests

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: In a tense morning of questioning, accused murderer Erin Patterson says multiple witnesses who have given evidence during her trial have been mistaken.

title.children: Erin Patterson disputes testimony of witnesses and family in mushroom murder trial

image.altText: GRETA THUNBERG plane

props.synopsis: Greta Thunberg is en route to Sweden after she and other activist were detained aboard a charity boat nearing Gaza.

title.children: Israel deports Thunberg after boarding Gaza-bound Freedom Flotilla ship

image.altText: A middle aged man in a black suit stands in a fancy wood-paneled room

props.synopsis: A decision by Tasmania's governor on whether the state moves to an early election has been delayed as the Governor seeks more time "to give due consideration to all available options".

title.children: Tasmanian state election decision delayed as governor considers 'all available options'

image.altText: two police walk down a street

props.synopsis: Several people have been killed at a school in the Austrian city of Graz, according to local authorities.

title.children: Breaking: Several people dead in Austrian school after shots heard, authorities say

image.altText: A man with a beard.

props.synopsis: Army veteran Cain Chambers says Toowong Private Hospital saved his life. Now it's closing down and he doesn't know where he'll get psychiatric care in future.

title.children: 'Rapacious profiteering' from health insurance industry blamed for closure of leading hospital

image.altText: Two officers with back to the camera and wearing jackets saying police ICE and HSI holding a man in cuffs

props.synopsis: A hacker who was responsible for one of the largest private breaches in Australia's history, has been arrested by the US immigration agency.

title.children: United States government says it will deport serial Australian hacker

image.altText: Police officers detain a demonstrator, throwing him to the ground asother officers gather with non-lethal firearms.

props.synopsis: Former US military officers say hundreds of marines deployed to the LA protests are from combat units, which was a drastic move that raises questions about President Donald Trump's intentions.

title.children: Ex-military officers raise concerns about 'combat unit' marines sent to LA

image.altText: A police vehicle parked in front of a brick house in a suburban area.

props.synopsis: A NSW father who killed his 15-year-old son before taking his own life had his firearms returned to him after a doctor's assessment, an inquest has heard.

title.children: Father had gun licence renewed before taking son's life, inquest hears

image.altText: A blurry CCTV image of a man with strawberry blonde hair and black jacket.

props.synopsis: A search is underway amid freezing conditions for a Victorian man believed to be missing in Tasmania's Cradle Mountain region.

title.children: Emergency services search for Victorian man missing at Cradle Mountain

image.altText: Bushwalkers were stranded in wild weather near Mt Kosciuszko

props.synopsis: Hikers visiting the alps are being urged to take the necessary precautions after a series of rescues in NSW and Victoria.

title.children: Couple stranded in blizzard rescued in 20-hour operation

image.altText: A group of men with blue and yellow flags around them and yelling.

props.synopsis: Russia and Ukraine exchange prisoners of war who are under the age of 25, marking the first steps of a series of planned prisoner swaps.

title.children: Russia and Ukraine exchange prisoners of war in emotional scenes

image.altText: Albanese press club

props.synopsis: The PM has used a speech to the National Press Club to announce an expert round table focused on economic growth and productivity.

title.children: Albanese opens search for ideas to shape second-term agenda

image.altText: A man sits with his hand covering his mouth at a meeting.

props.synopsis: With one mine still temporarily shut down and another smelter about to pause its operations, GFG Alliance workers across Australia are being left in limbo as Sanjeev Gupta's business woes continue.

title.children: Billionaire's business woes see hundreds of Australian workers sent home

image.altText: Jafar Panahi in a black suit and black glasses stands in front of a Sydney Film Festival sign on a red carpet

props.synopsis: This world-renowned Iranian director was barred from making films in his own country. Now, he has come to Sydney under a veil of secrecy to promote his latest work, which is based on his interrogations in prison.

title.children: This filmmaker couldn't say he was coming to Sydney until he was on the plane

image.altText: Dorian Gray 4

props.synopsis: Australian costume designer Marg Horwell speaks to the ABC about what made The Picture of Dorian Gray a Tony Award-winning success.

title.children: The costume designer that put Sarah Snook centrestage at the Tony Awards

image.altText: A wreath of purple flowers, with a black and white photo of a young boy in the middle.

props.synopsis: Family and friends of 29 people who died in a plane crash near Mackay 65 years ago gather to remember them, saying it feels "like yesterday".

title.children: Memory of Australia's worst civil aviation disaster 'still very raw'

image.altText: A close up of an embryo being created with scientific equipment in a lab.

props.synopsis: In an announcement to the ASX on Tuesday morning, Monash IVF said the incident happened on June 5 at its laboratory in Clayton, Melbourne.

title.children: Fertility group transfers wrong embryo for second time

image.altText: A man standing on a sunny cliff in the city with water behind him

props.synopsis: The Supreme Court murder trial heard Lisa Fenwick's final text before her death said she was "fearful" of the man now charged with killing her.

title.children: Woman’s final texts revealed as man represents himself at murder trial

image.altText: Man with a fringe looks into the camera wearing a COVID mask with a tiger on it.

props.synopsis: A disgraced school teacher who fled interstate has been jailed for sexually abusing young girls in Gippsland in the 1980s.

title.children: Paedophile teacher abused girl in presence of other students

image.altText: A carry bag filled with packages of cocaine.

props.synopsis: The haul of cocaine worth about $82 million, was found in a single Brisbane shipping container by the Australian Federal Police.

title.children: More than $80m worth of cocaine uncovered in shipping container

image.altText: McLaren's Lando Norris, McLaren's Oscar Piastri, Red Bull's Max Verstappen and drivers in action at the start of the race.

props.synopsis: Formula 1's new era will begin in Melbourne after the Australian Grand Prix was confirmed as the first race of the 2026 season.

title.children: F1's new era to begin at Australian Grand Prix with first race of 2026

image.altText: Gold medallist Summer McIntosh of Canada holding her medal, draped in the national flag

props.synopsis: Summer McIntosh has set a world record for the second time in three days at the Canadian Swimming Trials, with the 18-year-old eclipsing Hungarian great Katinka Hosszu's 200m individual medley mark set 10 years ago.

title.children: Canadian superstar sets second world record in three days

image.altText: A Black man in a yellow shirt bends over a water fountain and splashes his head with water.

props.synopsis: Early reports indicate this year's death toll at the Hajj pilgrimage is dramatically lower than last year's, but climate change still presents a major risk.

title.children: Last year, 1,300 pilgrims died at Mecca. Here's why this year was different

image.altText: An elderly, bearded man wearing an animal-fur hat on his head.

props.synopsis: Amid an extinction crisis, some amateur conservationists are taking matters into their own hands, releasing threatened animals on their properties. It's skirting rules and worrying scientists. But the guerilla rewilders say it's too late to wait for permission.

title.children: Unapproved rewilding stirs debate over ethics and animal welfare

image.altText: Crowds inside the airport.

props.synopsis: A Qantas flight (QF2) flying from London to Singapore has been forced to make an urgent landing in Azerbaijan, after a passenger suffered a life-threatening cardiac emergency mid-flight.

title.children: Aussies to depart Azerbaijan after Qantas flight's sudden diversion

image.altText: REA logo outside their office is of a red and white arrow going up

props.synopsis: It can cost thousands to list a property online for sale. The competition regulator has stepped in after years of complaints that REA Group is using its dominant position to the detriment of home sellers and real estate agents.

title.children: 'Complete market saturation': Real estate listings giant faces probe

image.altText: Saudi Arabia players celebrate

props.synopsis: The Socceroos are just a solid performance from reaching their sixth FIFA World Cup finals in a row, but must remain focused against Saudi Arabia in Jeddah. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: What the Socceroos need to qualify for the World Cup

image.altText: A man wearing a beige suit, waistcoat and striped tie, with a shadow cast on a bright yellow and orange background

props.synopsis: Sly Stone, the legendary bandleader of Sly and the Family Stone, has died at 82. These five songs show the power of his influence.

title.children: These 5 songs show how Sly Stone changed music forever

image.altText: A graphic of a de-identified boy sitting down with his hands over his face, with a dark generic background.

props.synopsis: A whistleblower says a 12-year-old boy with disabilities alleged to be the victim of indecent treatment in Cairns watch house has been flown to Brisbane and placed in housing "similar to a correctional facility".

title.children: 12yo boy put in house similar to 'correctional facility', whistleblower claims

image.altText: Muslim preacher Wissam Haddad arrives at court next to a man wearing a suit

props.synopsis: Speeches made by a Western Sydney preacher have been described as "humiliating" to Jews by lawyers acting for Australia's peak Jewish body.

title.children: Peak Jewish group calls Islamic preacher's speech 'dangerous' in court

image.altText: Exterior of the District Court of Western Australia on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: WARNING: This story contains graphic and distressing content. A mother and her husband allegedly engaged in sexual acts with her prepubescent daughter, who became a "sexual plaything", a Perth court hears.

title.children: Woman sexually abused daughter to satisfy husband, Perth court told

image.altText: Casey Kopua of the Giants attempts to block a shot

props.synopsis: Although most fans lost their minds at the sight of Kiwi legend Casey Kopua on a Super Netball court, some keyboard warriors were critical that she'd taken a pathway player's spot.

title.children: Kopua ignores keyboard warriors to inspire Giants in upset over defending premiers

image.altText: Crew walk away uninjured from spectacular Finke Desert Race crash

props.synopsis: A trophy truck driver and his navigator are "surprisingly well" after becoming airborne before a spectacular, cartwheeling crash during the Finke Desert Race.

title.children: Desert racers unscathed as wild 160kph crash caught on camera
